															<div class="terms-text"><table>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td></td>
<td colspan="4"><b>B6 Specification</b></td>
<td></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td></td>
<td colspan="4">Our B6 level are armoured using materials, both opaque and transparent, that meet or exceed the requirements of the European CEN 1522/23 and CEN 1063 standards to the level FB6 for opaque areas and BR6 for transparent areas</td>
<td></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td></td>
<td colspan="4"><strong>Armouring Details</strong></td>
<td></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td></td>
<td colspan="4">All four sides of the passenger compartment and the roof of the vehicle are protected using high-quality armour steel and glass defeating 7.62x51mm M80 Nato Ball ammunition (U.S. NIJ level III, CEN level FB6/BR6) and 5.56x45 SS109 ammunition (CEN level FB5/BR5 and FB6/BR6) at 0° incidence (90° to the surface) and 10m range according to CEN1063 and CEN1522.</td>
<td></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td></td>
<td colspan="4"><strong>Opaque Areas:</strong></td>
<td></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td></td>
<td colspan="4">All opaque areas including the roof are protected against the following and all lesser weapons/ ammunitions at 90° impact angle in accordance with the above specifications.
<ul>
 	<li>Calibre 7.62 x 39 mm, FJ/PB/FeC, AK 47 Kalashnikov</li>
 	<li>Calibre 5.56 x 45 mm, FJ/PB/SCP, M16 Colt</li>
 	<li>Calibre 7.62 x 51 mm, FJ/PB/SC, (FN) “FAL” / “LAR” NATO rifle</li>
</ul>
</td>
<td></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td></td>
<td colspan="4"><strong>Transparent Areas:</strong></td>
<td></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td></td>
<td colspan="4">All transparent areas are multi-layer and polycarbonate coated to protect against the following and all lesser weapons/ ammunitions at 90° impact angle in accordance with the above specifications.
<ul>
 	<li>Calibre 7.62 x 39 mm, FJ/PB/FeC, AK 47 Kalashnikov</li>
 	<li>Calibre 5.56 x 45 mm, FJ/PB/SCP, M16 Colt</li>
 	<li>Calibre 7.62 x 51 mm, FJ/PB/SC, (FN) “FAL” / “LAR” NATO rifle</li>
</ul>
</td>
<td></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td></td>
<td colspan="4"><strong>Floor</strong></td>
<td></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td></td>
<td colspan="4">Floor of the vehicle fitted with blast protection to protect occupants against fragmentation from simultaneous detonation of 2 DM-51 German ordnance hand grenades or equivalent.In addition, the floor also offers protection against anti-personnel mines.</td>
<td></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td></td>
<td colspan="5"><strong>Armouring design:</strong></td>
<td></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td></td>
<td colspan="5">The armouring is integrated inside the vehicle’s cab and forms a complete self-supporting structure so as to avoid excessive stress on the vehicle’s original structure.
<ul>
 	<li>The interior armour-frame provides overlap for the large-surface such as the door armour-plates and the windows.</li>
 	<li>Heavy-duty hinges with in-built door-stop.</li>
 	<li>Fuel-tank(s) protected with steel armour-plates.</li>
</ul>
</td>
<td></td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table></div>

															<div class="terms-text"><table>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td></td>
<td colspan="4"><b>B6 Specification</b></td>
<td></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td></td>
<td colspan="4">Our B6 level are armoured using materials, both opaque and transparent, that meet or exceed the requirements of the European CEN 1522/23 and CEN 1063 standards to the level FB6 for opaque areas and BR6 for transparent areas</td>
<td></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td></td>
<td colspan="4"><strong>Armouring Details</strong></td>
<td></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td></td>
<td colspan="4">All four sides of the passenger compartment and the roof of the vehicle are protected using high-quality armour steel and glass defeating 7.62x51mm M80 Nato Ball ammunition (U.S. NIJ level III, CEN level FB6/BR6) and 5.56x45 SS109 ammunition (CEN level FB5/BR5 and FB6/BR6) at 0° incidence (90° to the surface) and 10m range according to CEN1063 and CEN1522.</td>
<td></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td></td>
<td colspan="4"><strong>Opaque Areas:</strong></td>
<td></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td></td>
<td colspan="4">All opaque areas including the roof are protected against the following and all lesser weapons/ ammunitions at 90° impact angle in accordance with the above specifications.
<ul>
 	<li>Calibre 7.62 x 39 mm, FJ/PB/FeC, AK 47 Kalashnikov</li>
 	<li>Calibre 5.56 x 45 mm, FJ/PB/SCP, M16 Colt</li>
 	<li>Calibre 7.62 x 51 mm, FJ/PB/SC, (FN) “FAL” / “LAR” NATO rifle</li>
</ul>
</td>
<td></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td></td>
<td colspan="4"><strong>Transparent Areas:</strong></td>
<td></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td></td>
<td colspan="4">All transparent areas are multi-layer and polycarbonate coated to protect against the following and all lesser weapons/ ammunitions at 90° impact angle in accordance with the above specifications.
<ul>
 	<li>Calibre 7.62 x 39 mm, FJ/PB/FeC, AK 47 Kalashnikov</li>
 	<li>Calibre 5.56 x 45 mm, FJ/PB/SCP, M16 Colt</li>
 	<li>Calibre 7.62 x 51 mm, FJ/PB/SC, (FN) “FAL” / “LAR” NATO rifle</li>
</ul>
</td>
<td></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td></td>
<td colspan="4"><strong>Floor</strong></td>
<td></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td></td>
<td colspan="4">Floor of the vehicle fitted with blast protection to protect occupants against fragmentation from simultaneous detonation of 2 DM-51 German ordnance hand grenades or equivalent.In addition, the floor also offers protection against anti-personnel mines.</td>
<td></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td></td>
<td colspan="5"><strong>Armouring design:</strong></td>
<td></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td></td>
<td colspan="5">The armouring is integrated inside the vehicle’s cab and forms a complete self-supporting structure so as to avoid excessive stress on the vehicle’s original structure.
<ul>
 	<li>The interior armour-frame provides overlap for the large-surface such as the door armour-plates and the windows.</li>
 	<li>Heavy-duty hinges with in-built door-stop.</li>
 	<li>Fuel-tank(s) protected with steel armour-plates.</li>
</ul>
</td>
<td></td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table></div>
